    • Output configurations in edibble

    Output configurations in edibble

    edbl-output.Rmd
    library(edibble)

    Modifying the look of edibble nexus print output

    Let’s start off with looking at one of the classic designs stored as an edibble nexus object.

    nclassics$RCBD

    options(edibble.tree.decorate.trts = cli::bg_cyan,
        edibble.tree.decorate.units = function(x) cli::bg_yellow(glue::glue("<{x}>")),
        edibble.tree.decorate.resp = cli::col_yellow,
        edibble.tree.decorate.levels = function(x) cli::style_inverse(glue::glue("({x})")),
        edibble.tree.decorate.main = cli::style_underline)

nclassics$RCBD

    Modify label outputs in edibble data frame

    redefine_struct <- function() {
  initiate_design() %>% 
  set_units(block = 10,
            plot = nested_in(block, 20),
            plants = nested_in(plot, 5)) %>% 
  serve_table()
}

redefine_struct()
#> # An edibble: 1,000 x 3
#>    block      plot        plants    
#>    <unit(10)> <unit(200)> <unit(1k)>
#>  1 block1     plot1       plants1   
#>  2 block1     plot1       plants2   
#>  3 block1     plot1       plants3   
#>  4 block1     plot1       plants4   
#>  5 block1     plot1       plants5   
#>  6 block1     plot2       plants6   
#>  7 block1     plot2       plants7   
#>  8 block1     plot2       plants8   
#>  9 block1     plot2       plants9   
#> 10 block1     plot2       plants10  
#> # … with 990 more rows
    options(edibble.levels.label.leading_zero = TRUE)
redefine_struct()
#> # An edibble: 1,000 x 3
#>    block      plot        plants    
#>    <unit(10)> <unit(200)> <unit(1k)>
#>  1 block01    plot001     plants0001
#>  2 block01    plot001     plants0002
#>  3 block01    plot001     plants0003
#>  4 block01    plot001     plants0004
#>  5 block01    plot001     plants0005
#>  6 block01    plot002     plants0006
#>  7 block01    plot002     plants0007
#>  8 block01    plot002     plants0008
#>  9 block01    plot002     plants0009
#> 10 block01    plot002     plants0010
#> # … with 990 more rows
    options(edibble.levels.label.leading_zero = TRUE,
        edibble.levels.label.min_ndigits = 5)
redefine_struct()
#> # An edibble: 1,000 x 3
#>    block      plot        plants     
#>    <unit(10)> <unit(200)> <unit(1k)> 
#>  1 block00001 plot00001   plants00001
#>  2 block00001 plot00001   plants00002
#>  3 block00001 plot00001   plants00003
#>  4 block00001 plot00001   plants00004
#>  5 block00001 plot00001   plants00005
#>  6 block00001 plot00002   plants00006
#>  7 block00001 plot00002   plants00007
#>  8 block00001 plot00002   plants00008
#>  9 block00001 plot00002   plants00009
#> 10 block00001 plot00002   plants00010
